chargeHist.descr: Sexual Assault of a Child Under 16 Years of Age

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Zero days of jail credit if revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad C. Hunter

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on September 9, 2025 at 09:30 am.

11:31 AM case called. Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad C. Hunter in court with Attorney Ryan J. Moertel. Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Victim witness associate makes statement on behalf of the victim. Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1: Exposing Intimate Parts as apart of a 36 month Deferred Acceptance Agreement Plea. Courts accepts the plea and withholds finding of guilt.

State moves to amend Count 2 to 4th Degree Sexual Assault, Court accepts. 

Defendant pleads guilty to amended Count 2: 4th Degree Sexual Assault. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.

Defendant makes statement.

Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
No contact with L.F. for 6 months following today's plea.
After 6 months contact can occur with L.F. only with written approval from L.F., probation agent, DAGP coordinator and DHS.
No unsupervised, intentional contact with any minor children. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Court costs
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 9, 2025 at 09:30 am.
